Enact law to curb violence against docto.description: CHANDIGARH: Members of the Indian Medical Association (IMA), Chandigarh, its Mohali unit and resident doctors of Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH), Sector 32, held a meeting at the Dr P N Chuttani Memorial IMA Complex, Sector 35, on Monday. Dr Hardeep S Santokh, secretary, IMA, Chandigarh, said the call for withdrawal of non-essential services was necessary as the West Bengal government was adamant in its approach. The IMA said the 24-hour shutdown was just a glimpse of what could follow if the issues were not addressed. Dr Sushil Gupta, former president, IMA, Chandigarh, said more than 1,000 senior doctors had resigned from government hospitals owing to the “inhumane treatment” meted out to their junior colleagues. He said the IMA has a zero tolerance policy against violence on doctors and healthcare establishments and a Central Prevention of Violence against Medicare Services persons and Establishment Act has been a long pending demand of the association. Dr Neeraj Kumar, former president, IMA, Chandigarh, said that this law should be stringent enough to act as a deterrent. The IMA on Monday also submitted a memorandum of their demands, including immediate adoption of an existent state law for prevention of violence against doctors and creation of a hotline with a quick response team headed by a senior police official to pre-empt such incidents to the senior administrative officers of the city. Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." City doctors send OPDs in ICU.description: CHANDIGARH: Outdoor patient department (OPD) services were on Monday affected in all three major hospitals — PGIMER, Government Multi-specialty Hospital, Sector 16, and Government Medical College and Hospital, Sector 32 — as doctors called off work to express solidarity with their colleagues in Kolkata. Thousands of patients who reached these hospitals had to return home without check-up. The most-affected were those who had come from far-off places, especially to PGI OPDs. Hori Lal, a resident of Mandi Gobindgarh, Punjab, had come to PGI in the morning after taking a leave without pay from the mill where he works to show his wife who has been experiencing pain in her right hand. He reached at 10am and waited till 1pm before returning disappointed. “I had to spend Rs 700 to come here with my wife and daughter. But this time it was all for a waste. We will have to return next Monday now as the doctor only sits on that day. She has extreme pain in her hand and was hopeful of getting some relief today. We had thought the cause of pain would be known and medicine would be given for relief as we got the CT scan report along, but no one saw it,” he said. In the sectors 16 and 32 hospitals, OPDS were shut down at 8.30am, while PGI doctors had announced on Sunday that they would suspend work in OPDs. In all three hospitals, especially in PGI, the faculty attended to patients in OPDs. In PGI, a contingency plan was devised to ensure functioning of the institute to the maximum extent possible. The OPD services were curtailed by reducing the registration timings by two hours. The OPD and diagnostic services were run by faculty, sponsored residents, foreign national residents and technical staff. As many as 3,596 patients were registered in the OPD on Monday, while 23 surgeries were performed till 5pm. All the emergency services, including labour room services, and intensive care units, functioned in a routine manner as these services were exempted from strike. Dr Jagat Ram, director, PGI, called a meeting of heads of departments on Sunday at 8 am to discuss the issue and prepare a contingency plan. Accordingly, a contingency plan was drafted and distributed to all heads of departments on Sunday itself. Dr BS Chavan, director, GMCH, said, “Though doctors called a shutdown, our faculty worked hard and covered 1,500 patients in the OPDs on Monday. They were on night duty as well. If the strike continues, our faculty will be at work.” In the protest on Monday, the doctors of three hospitals were joined in by members of Indian Medical Association (IMA), Chandigarh, Mohali and Panchkula units, which too had called for a strike for 24 hours till Tuesday. Doctors from different institutes joined the protest march in the evening. Dr Uttam Thakur, president, Association of Resident Doctors, PGI, said, “There is a need to enact laws in the entire country for safety of the doctors. Central security Act needs to be implemented in the whole of the country.” He said that if the demands were not, then they might even suspend emergency services, but added it would be the last resort. Spend more on health: PGI doctorDr Siddharth Jain, senior resident, rheumatology, PGI, said, “There is lack of understanding between patients and doctors and this is because of the lack of facilities. Public sentiments increase because of the delay in getting services as either there is shortage of doctors or that of hospitals.” “There is a need to increase the money being spent on health in the country, which at present does not match with the standards of WHO. We need to strengthen the infrastructure. All the doctors joining in for the cause shows the severity of the situation and need for the government to act fast,” he said. \nNGO organizes fund raiser for special.description: Model and actress, Neet Mahal was in town recently to take part in a fund raiser event for special children. In the event, she was joined by Gagan Verma, Mr Supermodel Universe, Ruby Singh, actor and model and fitness expert Dr Vibha Bawa, winner of North Indian Queen 2018 and Ayurveda expert Sanjana Sharma, ex-banker and Mrs. India Beauty Queen 2018, Dr Tetiana Kapranova an endocrinologist, therapist and fashion model, Sam Rattan, actor-model and anchor, Dr Rimple Sharma, Mrs. Chandigarh Queen 2018. ‘Elysian Diva’, the fund raiser event was organized by Empower, a city based project, which works for special children betterment in association with Surkhwabh. The event was also a tribute to the supreme sacrifice of Deputy Commandant Joy Lal whose 20 th martyrdom day falls on May 30. During occasion, around dozen special children walked the ramp along with celebrities. Wheelchair Indian Cricket team players including Ranjit Singh, Nirmal Singh and Veer Singh Sandhu also joined kids in ramp walk and show. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mohali municipal corporation procures 90.description: MOHALI: After having missed several deadlines, the Mohali Municipal Corporation has restarted the process for garbage segregation at source system, and this time the attempt seems to be serious as the civic body has procured 90 rehris to collect segregated garbage from the source point. Taking a serious note, the civic body has instructed rehri pullers not to accept garbage from household if it is not segregated. Deputy mayor, Manjit Singh Sethi said that the mixed garbage will not be accepted at the centralized garbage dumping site. Even as Sethi has instructed the segregation at the source point, that is the household, some councillors fear that residents and rehri pullers might not take up the trouble and on the contrary said this way residents and rehri pullers may dump garbage at secluded places instead of segregating at source. Sethi said, “MC has recently procured 90 such rehris in which each rehri will be divided into two chambers where segregated garbage is to be transported.” Mayor Kulwant Singh said, “This project requires full co-operation of residents, and councillors for making it a success. We were to attain the target of April 30 for implementing garbage segregation at source but two months were eaten up by the election code of conduct.” Surprisingly, the garbage segregation project, which was launched on a trial basis from Sector 71 around mid-April 2017, has not caught on even among residents of that area so far. Local bodies minister, Navjot Singh Sidhu had formally launched the project in the town on June 5, 2017. After that the concept faded in its tune and residents did not comply with the concept. Earlier also the civic body has been able to sell not more than 150 dustbins at a discounted price so far. A provision for purchasing 10,000 dustbins was made by the corporation which has been stalled after facing very poor response to the concept. The MC now has rehris with two chambers, centralised garbage dumping station to accept only segregated garbage only, it will be duty of rehri puller to dump segregated garbage or it will not be accepted at centralised dumping site. Panchkula traffic police get 25 new bike.description: PANCHKULA:Haryana director general of police (DGP) Manoj Yadava on Monday launched 25 special motorcycles at the Sector 14 police station. These bikes will assist the Panchkula police commissionerate quick response team (QRT) to provide road safety. The new motorcycles have been added to traffic unit of Panchkula under the initiative. The QRT team was flagged off by Haryana DGP along with Panchkula police commissioner (CP) Saurabh Singh and deputy commissioner of police (DCP) Kamaldeep Goyal. The motorcycles equipped with sirens and flash lights have been given by a private company as per its corporate social responsibility) initiative. Harbhajan Singh, director of the private company manufacturing the motorcycles, was also present on the occasion. Goyal said, “These QRT bikes will help them in traffic safety and prove helpful in controlling criminal activities like theft and snatching in the district.” CP Singh said, “All QRT vehicles will reach the accident spot at the earliest and ensure the smooth flow of traffic apart from helping the injured to get medical help and evacuating them at the earliest”. The DGP said, “The commissionerate should use these QRT vehicles for safety on national and state highways. The accident-prone areas of the commissionerate should be checked and cops issue challans on these stretches.” There are 28 PCR and 26 motorcycle riders deployed in the district day and night for crime control. Now, the addition of these 25 new motorcycles in district police will further aid in controlling the crime effectively, officials said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man wanted in 50 ATM fraud cases held in.description: MOHALI: The cyber crime cell of Mohali police have arrested a person habitual of duping elderly persons especially women who come to ATMs to withdraw money. According to the police, the accused used to offer help to elderly persons in operating ATM machine and then take note of the pin number or change their debit card and later withdraw money. Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Harcharan Singh Bhullar said the case was under investigation of deputy superintendent of police (DSP) Rupinderdeep Kaur Sohi and her team and they have solved the case with the arrest of the accused. DSP Sohi said the accused identified as Satish Kumar has been arrested and produced in court which remanded him to police custody. Sohi said the modus operandi of the accused was that he used to first identify the target either elderly person or women finding it hard to operate the ATM. He then used to offer help and after withdrawing the money, he would change the ATM card with a dummy card after noting down the pin number. Then he used to withdraw money after using the original ATM card of the victim. Sohi said that the accused has been nabbed after thoroughly scrutinizing the CCTV footages of the various ATMs which have been named in the complaints by the victims. Sohi said, “We have then connected the presence of a common person at various CCTV footages where the accused had tricked the victims. The common person was the identified and arrested.” Police said that Satish along with his accomplices Kuldeep Singh alias Gudu has already been arrested by Mohali police in some other crime and Sonu has been arrested by Chandigarh police for similar crime. Now Mohali police will get the other two on production warrants. They all are accused of ATM frauds in Chandigarh, Mohali, Ambala, Ropar, Himachal Pradesh, Delhi and western UP. They all are natives of Uttar Pradesh and presently residing in a rented accommodation in Dadumajra, Chandigarh. Satish has confessed to have committed 50 such frauds in the state. Modus operandiAccording to the police, the accused mostly targeted elderly persons especially women. He would offer help to elderly persons to operate the ATM machine and then take down the pin number. Later, he would change their ATM cards with dummy cards and withdraw money. He was identified with the help of CCTV cameras installed in ATMs across the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Now, traders may be involved for impleme.description: CHANDIGARH: As the UT administration and the Chandigarh municipal corporation is facing stiff opposition from various traders’ body on creating vending zones in city, the administration now plans to involve traders and various market bodies for implementation of street vending policy. A senior UT official said they want to accommodate vendors in different vending zones in the city, but with the consent of traders as well. They have now planned to involve traders, while creating vending zones in the city. The final decision in this regard will be taken next week, he added. There were protests from traders of sectors 17, 15 and 22, in recent past against the UT and MC’s move to rehabilitate vendors in these markets. On the other side, the Chandigarh municipal corporation has completed the first round of the draw of lots already and allotted 3,000 street-vending sites around the city. It has suspended the process for the time being, since the matter was pending before the Punjab and Haryana high court. The town vending committee has already approved a fine of Rs 50,000 and registration of a criminal case if any vendor is found procuring fake certificates. The authorities will check the documents of the vendors time and again and in the coming days certificates equipped with security feature will be issued to them. Recently, the Punjab and Haryana high court had expressed its dissatisfaction over the definition given by the UT under the Street Vending Act. The high court had pointed out that how come footpaths and parking zones could be called streets. The HC also had made a satirical remark and said that if footpaths and parking zones could be streets then UT should also include parks under the Street Vending Act and allow street vendors there. There are a total 9,200 vendors in the city. Of these, 1,900 deal with essential commodities and they will stay at their existing place of vending due to the nature of their services. Besides, 6,500 registered vendors deal in non-essential commodities, who will be accommodated in vending zones identified by the Chandigarh administration. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Oyo, hotel in Dharamshala fined \u20b9 1.description: CHANDIGARH:District consumer disputes redressal directed Oravel Stays Private Limited in New Delhi and Hotel Nandini Homestay in Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh, to pay Rs 10,000 as compensation for failing to provide proper rooms to the complainant despite advanced booking. They were also directed to refund the entire booking amount of Rs 8,702 to the complainant. Veer Singh, the complainant, who is a practicing advocate, booked hotel accommodation on June 13, 2016 for three days and two nights in two rooms, one a double occupancy which the complainant had booked for his friend, and the other a triple occupancy, which the complainant had booked for himself and his family in Hotel Nandini Homestay, situated in Dharamshala, through Oravel’s website, oyorooms-.com. The complainant checked into the hotel according to the schedule on June 24, 2016. After check-in, the proprietor of the hotel approached the complaint and claimed that the two rooms into which the complainant and his friend checked-in had already been booked prior to the complainant making the booking through oyorooms.com and offered to shift them to better rooms. The complainant did not accede to the aforesaid offer and slept there on the night of June 24, 2016. On June 25, 2016, the complainant embarked on a trip to McLeod Ganj with his family after placing the keys of the rooms with the staff only for housekeeping and room cleaning. However, upon return to the hotel, the complainant was shocked to see that without his consent the luggage and other personal items were shifted to different set of rooms, which were the worst of the lot in the entire hotel. The complainant tried to contact the proprietor of the hotel, but to no avail. The complainant said he even requested oyorooms-.com to arrange a habitable room in the said hotel or to accommodate them in a different hotel of equal footing, but nothing came out of it. In its reply, Oravel stated that it entered into the agreement on March 15, 2016 with the hotel to promote its hotel to expand its business. According to the agreement, their responsibility and liability was limited to the extent of booking that was conducted on their platform and that they would only try to resolve issues that a customer may face during the visit. The sole responsibility of the operation of the said hotel was of the owner of hotel. According to the record maintained by the hotel, there was only one issue raised by the complainant for changing the rooms provided and the same was resolved. Moreover, website cannot be held liable for any act done by the hotel. No one appeared on behalf of the hotel. Forum after hearing both sides stated that, “Since the booking was made through its platform, we are of the concerted opinion that Oravel is substantially involved with the hotel in selling hotel services to prospective consumers and under the garb of marketing, both are running a joint venture. Thus, oravel cannot be allowed to evade its liability on the ground that its role is limited to the extent of arranging the hotel booking through its platform. The hotel and the website have certainly and definitely indulged into unfair trade practice, the forum held. Also, they did not bother to redress the grievance of the complainant when contacted by him, resulting in immense, mental and physical harassment to the complainant, forum observed. Based on the findings hotel and Oravel were directed to pay up. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

6 SHOs, 5 other cops dismissed.description: PATIALA: The Punjab police on Monday dismissed 11 cops, including six station house officers, three head constables and two constables, after they were found guilty of wrongdoings in departmental inquiries against them. Senior superintendent of police (SSP) Mandeep Singh Sidhu said these cops were facing charges under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985 and of corruption. Those facing charges under the NDPS Act include head constable Amarjit Singh and constables Narinderpal Singh and Gurpartap Singh. Dismissed cops facing corruption charges are assistant sub-inspectors Shivdev Singh (bribe of Rs 5,000), Sahib Singh (local rank, bribe of Rs 10,000), Tehal Singh (local rank, bribe of Rs 35,000), Jangir Singh (local rank, bribe of Rs 10,000), Sukhwinder Kaur (local rank, bribe of Rs 10,000) and Gurmeet Singh (local rank). Head constables Harjinder Singh (bribe of Rs 14,000) and Baljinder Singh (bribe of Rs 25,000) too have been dismissed. Also, 81 police personnel in Patiala district have been promoted and awarded for exemplary services during the last 11 months. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

After Deol, chief secy checks work on co.description: Dera Baba Nanak: Two days after BJP Gurdaspur MP Sunny Deol visited Dera Baba Nanak to review the progress of Kartarpur corridor on the Indian side, Punjab chief secretary Karan Avtar Singh visited the site along with senior officials of the state on Monday. Karan Avtar was accompanied by Punjab director general of police Dinkar Gupta, additional chief secretary (housing and urban development) Vinni Mahajan, inspector general of police (IGP) Kunwar Vijay Partap Singh, Gurdaspur deputy commissioner Vipul Ujjwal and Batala senior superintendent of police (SSP) O S Ghumman. BJP’s local leadership claimed that the chief secretary visited the corridor to deflect attention from the newly-elected MP’s visit to the corridor. After reviewing work, the chief secretary held a meeting with officials of various departments at the Border Security Force headquarters in Shikar Machhian village and directed them to complete the corridor by November 2019. He said many development works were being carried out on priority at historical and religious towns of Dera Baba Nanak and Batala . The DC said projects worth Rs 24 crore would be carried out in 11 villages near Dera Baba Nanak . “The estimates are ready and work will begin soon,” he said. Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

\nCancer survivors get treated to a film.description: Nearly 150 cancer survivors and their near & dear ones today bonded with their doctors and nurses over a film and popcorn as they enjoyed themselves at an exclusive screening of the Salman Khan starrer latest fim ‘Bharat’ organised for them by Saarthak, the cancer support group of a cancer institute in Mohali, at a city-based mall multiplex. The get-together of the cancer survivors was done on Cancer Survivor’s Day that is celebrated worldwide to demonstrate that life after a cancer diagnosis can be a reality. The cancer survivors thoroughly enjoyed the movie as well as the snacks served to them. “When you are faced with this dreaded disease, your life changes dramatically and you tend to become depressed and full of self-pity,” stated Satish Bhatia, who was diagnosed with cancer and underwent treatment at the institute. Dr Rajeev Bedi, director of the institute in Mohali suggested to the cancer survivors to reach out to other members of the community and get them to join any free support group like Saarthak. DGP finds faults at Haryana\u2019s \u201.description: PANCHKULA: Electricity wires hanging precariously and non-maintenance of record in the CCTV control room were among the anomalies Haryana director general of police (DGP) Manoj Yadava detected at the Sector 14 police station awarded for being the cleanest throughout Haryana last year The DGP conducted the check after the launching ceremony of quick response team motorcycles, taking the cops by surprise. While going to the first floor to check the CCTV control room, the DGP asked commissioner of police (CP) Saurabh Singh to maintain the lockups. On the left side of the staircase on the ground floor, he noticed that the electricity meter was lying open and in a poor condition. Wires were hanging from them and touching the ground floor. Wires were hanging from a meter at the Sector 14 police station in Panchkula on MondayAt the CCTV control room, the DGP was shocked to learn the authorities were not maintaining any record of suspected vehicles/persons crossing the roads. The DGP directed the CP and deputy commissioner of police (DCP) to maintain a register otherwise the control room would only help in issuing challans and lose its purpose. At the ground floor, he pointed out the poor connection of split air conditioner on the staircase, with the wires hanging. The CP later called the Sector 14 police station house officer inspector Naveen to a separate room and discussed the issues raised by the DGP and directed him to correct the faults. Sectors 19, 21 suffer due to strays, say.description: CHANDIGARH: The reality is that the dog population, instead of coming down due to animal birth control measures taken by the municipal corporation (MC), seem to have exploded. The situation is worse in Sector 19 and Sector 21, where the residents claim that the area is teeming with dogs. According to the dispensary records at Sector 19, approximately 350 dog bite cases, involving both stray and domestic dogs, are reported every month. Residents said that they are finding it difficult to even step outside their houses. When TOI visit the two sectors, residents said that they have to carry laathis with them to keep the dogs away. They also said that when the MC tries to relocate the dogs, they face objection from a few animal lovers who live in the area. According to them, dogs not only bite, but they also chase twowheelers and four-wheelers, which sometimes result in accidents. According to 2012 dog census, there were 7,847 stray dogs and 9,824 domestic dogs in Chandigarh. The number has risen to 13,000-14,000 in the last four to five years, the reason being the uncontrolled breeding of these dogs. Acknowledging the complaints and concerns of the residents, Asha Jaswal, the area councillor, said, “When we receive complaints about dogs, the MC sends dog catchers to catch the dog. They then keep the dog in shelter homes for four to five days and release them after vaccination, according to ABC guidelines. If a dog is ill or not sterilized, he is sterilized and kept for 10-12 days in the shelter homes.” “We have complained to the MC many times, but they are unable to handle the situation. Vaccinating the dogs alone is not a solution. They will still bite. We cannot send our children out to play,” said Reena Mittal, a resident of Sector 19. Some of the locals say the solution lie in creating pounds for them far away from the city. Satya Bhatia, a resident of Sector 21B, said, “It is more dangerous for children and pregnant women since they cannot defend themselves from an attacking pack.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandigarh: \u2018Pedicure, vitamins, we.description: CHANDIGARH:The rooster which has robbed the peace of a military veteran is living no ordinary life. The bird is fully vaccinated against poultry diseases, maintains a high-level of hygiene, gets a pedicure often and is given a liver tonic, according to the owner, as she reacted to the police complaint against her pet. That’s not all. Brownie is given vitamins daily for a good immunity system, has been dewormed once and his next deworming date is coming close, she said. “Other than this, our Brownie has had liver tonic for good health and is completely vaccinated against poultry diseases. Cleanliness is a big thing in our home and we clean Brownie’s living space daily, using products like Dettol for his bedsheets and phenyl for our floors for better hygiene. He is given a bath once a week, nails are trimmed and beak filed. We give him oregano oil pedicures,” said the owner in a communication sent to TOI on Monday. The reply, in which the bird owner requested not to disclose their identity, also stated that the complainant has been creating undue pressure on them to forcefully remove Brownie from their home, which, according to her, is illegal. Major H S Dilawari, a retired veteran and senior citizen residing along with his wife at Army Flats, Sector 47, Chandigarh, has given a complaint to police seeking action against his neighbour, whose pet has been disturbing his peace. “Being senior citizens me and my wife are dealing with multiple health problems for which a sound rest is needed which is constantly broken with loud cock-adoodle doo during early hours and in the afternoon. Catching up on sleep again is impossible,” the veteran has mentioned in his police complaint. He has also stated that it has also become a nuisance for the whole building, with hygiene being a big concern as bird flu can affect small children in the building. While police complaint has mentioned that nuisance is created by a rooster and hen, the woman in her response to the complaint has claimed that she only has a pet rooster. It has also been claimed that the drain and staircase in the society, which is a shared space, has been cleaned only them. She claimed the complainant has been pressurizing them to leave their rented house by complaining to her landlord and creating problems. “For them, he might be just a rooster, but for us, he is a beloved family member, who has been with us since he was three weeks old. I have raised him like my own, have fed him from my hands and he sleeps on my lap. Compassion towards animals is lacking in people these days. This harassment has saddened me and my family greatly,” said the woman. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Zirakpur bizman loses \u20b975L in gym c.description: PANCHKULA: A 47-year-old businessman has been allegedly duped of Rs 75 lakh in the name of a starting a franchisee of a popular fitness gym brand, leading the court to direct the police to register a case against the accused. Virender Sharma, a resident of New Generations Apartments,Zirakpur, alleged Bangalore residents Satya Sinha and his wife Shardul approached him, claiming to be top officials of Chisel Fitness, a company they claimed was running a chain of gyms across the country. He said as he was keen to start a business in the fitness sector, he responded to the accused. They introduced themselves as advanced fitness centre service providers and claimed a popular cricketer owns the brand with them. The victim met the accused in 2017 through one Mohit. The victim said he got lured after the accused named the cricketer as their partner. The accused told the victim that they were planning to set up 100 branches across the country by 2018. The accused in different transactions demanded Rs 75.01 lakh which were deposited by the victim through a bank located in Sector 9. An agreement among both the parties was signed on January 12, 2018, with an understanding to start the venture by setting up a gymnasium immediately and thereafter opening one by April 15, 2018. The victim arranged commercial space of 11,000 sq ft on leasehold basis at Elante Mall, Industrial Area, Phase I, Chandigarh, for setting up the gymnasium but to no avail. The accused allegedly also stopped attending/taking his phone calls. The accused lodged a complaint with the police but when they did not entertain his complaint, he moved the district court, Panchkula. On the directions of judicial magistrate first class (JMIC) Saurbh Gupta, a case was registered under sections 406 (punishment for criminal breach of trust), 420 (cheating) and 34 (act done by several person with same intention) of the IPC (Indian penal code) at the Sector 5 police station. PGIMS doc\u2019s suicide: Strike called.description: ROHTAK: The strike by resident doctors of PGIMS here over the suicide by an MD student ended on its fourth day on Monday. Dr Omkar of MD final year had committed suicide on Thursday, after which his colleagues had registered an FIR against their head of department Dr Geeta Gathwala, alleging that she had mentally tortured the deceased. Chief adviser of Resident Doctors’ Association, Rohtak, Dr Satbir Singh said that they had a long meeting with PGIMS vice-chancellor Dr O P Kalra and decided to end the strike in the larger interest of patients. “We were assured that maximum compensation would be given to the deceased’s family, the matter would be taken to the chief minister’s office and the police would make no delay in the arrest of accused Dr Geeta Gathwala after proper investigations,” he added. The PGIMS authorities had been trying to persuade the striking doctors, who were so far unwilling to give up their core demands of arrest of Dr Gathwala and Rs 1-crore compensation to the bereaved family. However, the situation changed with new details emerging in the incident and a cross-case being filed against some junior doctors for vandalizing Dr Gathwala’s house. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. \nPhilosophical perspective of Ganga thr.description: Pracheen Kala Kendra organized a spectacular dance ballet ‘Ganga’ by the students of Kendra in the direction of Kathak exponent Dr. Samira Koser at Tagore Theatre. There were about 80 participants between the ages of 5 to 55, who gave ample proof of training given bytheir Guru Koser. This programme was split in two parts, one was Dance ballet Ganga and other, pure kathak dance presentations of Jaipur Gharana. After the lighting of traditional lamp, the programme got a majestic start with Ganga. This dance ballet gives a message that we should awaken and purify Ganga as well as our souls and be good human beings before it’s too late. This ballet was presented by Shubhra Koser, Amrita, Anu, Divya, Mehak, Savitri, Tanaya, Sonika, anushka, Geetika, Pranjal , Ojaswita , Sargam and Gursimran. Fight for Rohtang permit ends.description: MANALI: The struggle to visit Rohtang Pass, it seems, has finally ended after a large number of permits were left unsold on the official website. Despite the fact that permits can be booked a week in advance there were no takers for June 24 till late Monday evening. Infact, a large number of permits are available for June 20, 21, 22 and 23 and they can be booked easily by anybody. Of late, all 1,300 permits were seen getting booked within 30 seconds of opening of the website window every day. Until last week, local taxi drivers were hiring others to book permit for them at a higher cost. Both tourists and taxi operators even resorted to agitations, shouted slogans against administration for the want of permits. But as the tourist season comes to a close the taxi operators refuse to waste permit fee of Rs 550. “We are not getting advance booking as number of tourists visiting Manali is decreasing every day,” said a taxi operator Chaman Thakur. “The peak season will end by June 25. We are expecting the last batch of bumper crowd in coming weekend. We shall book permit only if we are approached by tourists,” he added. There is a cap of 800 petrol and 400 diesel engine vehicles who can get permit to visit Rohtang Pass for tourism purpose on a daily basis. Besides, 100 special permits are available for non-Himachal vehicles. Until last week, over 20,000 permits were in demand every day. It is expected that Manali would get relief from long traffic jams in the coming days. However, demand for permits for Ladakh and Lahaul has increased which will keep the Manali-Rohtang highway busy till the end of this month. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Painful experience for 43-yr-old at Panc.description: PANCHKULA: Forty-three-year-old Anil Kumar, who lost his right leg to an accident, was denied dressing to his wounds by the staff of civil hospital, Sector 6, due to the closure of the OPD on Monday amid doctors’ strike. Only the emergency and labour wing of the hospital were functional on the day. Anil and his relative Ashok, both Yamunanagar residents, had come to Panchkula for some work when the former suddenly complained of severe pain and blood oozing out of his wounds. He was rushed to the hospital only to find disappointment at first. Ashok then complained about the same to the principal medical officer (PMO) at the hospital, following which a few doctors came to his rescue and dressed his wounds. “If the emergency wing is functional, why was I denied treatment at first? It was an emergency to me. I was in severe pain in my injured leg,” complained Anil. When asked about the hospital’s arrangements amid the ongoing protest, chief medical officer (CMO) Dr Yogesh Sharma said, “On a regular basis, we have at least two doctors in the emergency wing, but as the OPD is shut, we have increased the number of doctors in the emergency room to eight. Doctors are working different shifts.” “Regular patients are also attended at the emergency department. Moreover, the gynaecology ward is also functional with doctors available 24x7,” the CMO added. Healthcare services took a hit on Monday across the country. At civil hospital Sector 6, some patients faced difficulty in getting treatment while the doctors claimed that extra staff was appointed in the emergency wing to avoid any inconvenience to the patients. The All Indian Medical Association (IMA) held a nationwide doctors’ strike in solidarity with the protesting doctors in Kolkata. The IMA had decided to withdraw all non-essential services on Monday. Its members also staged a dharna at its headquarters in New Delhi. Emergency and casualty services, however, will continue to function. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Women made to lie on floor after tubecto.description: JALANDHAR: The state health department ordered probe into the incident where 33 women, apparently from economically weaker section, were made to lie on floor after tubectomy. The episode was reported during a family planning camp in Nakodar civil hospital, where women were made to lie down in a room and a corridor on rugs. It was captured in a video, which was shared widely on social media. The camp was organized on June 4, by Mehatpur community health centre at the Nakodar hospital. Surgeries were conducted by two doctors from Jalandhar and the patients were discharged soon after monitoring their vitals for couple of hours. On Tuesday, Jalandhar civil surgeon Dr Rajesh Bagga formed a three-member panel and asked them to submit a report by Tuesday. However, additional chief secretary for health Satish Chandra asked the civil surgeon to personally inquire into the episode and submit a report by Tuesday. Dr Bagga confirmed the development. It is the second case of negligence reported from a government hospital in Jalandhar. On June 11 night, a class VI employee was caught on camera stitching wounds of an injured patient. While an inquiry has already been conducted in the case, final action by health department is yet to be taken. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Brain dead woman's gives fresh lease of.description: CHANDIGARH: Luck smiled on two hapless patients suffering from terminal renal diseases and hanging in the hope of finding a kidney donor and two other corneal blind patients endlessly waiting for restoration of their sight when a benevolent family from village Salapur, Chamkaur Sahib, district Ropar displayed an exemplary gesture of magnanimity and consented to donate the organs of one Jasvir Kaur. The donor family’s compassion gave fresh lease of life to both the renal failure patients with the transplantation of kidneys and brought smiles to the other two corneal blind patients with the ‘gift of sight’,” stated Prof. Vipin Koushal, Nodal Officer, ROTTO PGIMER while detailing about the latest case of cadaver organ donation here at PGIMER. Somnath, the brave heart husband of donor Jasvir Kaur, who consented for organ donation, while expressing his sentiments, said “Compassion and care for others was the very essence of my wife’s being. So with complete surrender to the Almighty, ‘Tera bhana mitha lage’, we just did what even my wife would have wanted us to do. It felt as if it is a duty assigned from Him to save other families from the pain and trauma that we are confronted with." One of the family’s close relatives Gurmeet Singh, an employee with PGIMER, who was present through the process, shared, “Being a devout family, they strongly believe in ‘sewa’ and keep organising community kitchens (langar) at PGIMER for the poor patients. There cannot be bigger ‘sewa’ than saving the life of someone. So when the family of donor Jasvir Kaur understood the concept of Organ Donation, there was no hesitation, no re-thinking and they just went ahead with their decision.” On the fateful day, Jasvir Kaur was going on a scooter with her son for a routine courtesy call to some relatives when another two wheeler hit their scooter from the side and due to sudden push, Jasvir Kaur losing her balance, fell from the pillion and sustained fatal head injuries. After the initial treatment in a local civil hospital, the patient was rushed to PGIMER on the same day. However, nothing could change the destiny, neither the best of medical attention nor the ardent prayers of the family and friends as Jasvir Kaur could not be retrieved from her precarious condition and was finally declared brain dead on 12th June following the protocols of THOA. It was then the Transplant Coordinator here at PGIMER flagged the option of Organ Donation to the family. But even in this darkest hour, husband Som Nath, amid his own grief, showed exceptional courage and magnanimity by consenting to donate the organs of his deceased wife Jasvir Kaur. Following the consent, the deceased’s kidneys were harvested and transplanted to two best matched renal failure patients giving them a second chance to live. The retrieved corneas were transplanted to another two patients, restoring their eye sight and bringing light to their lives. It was a sight of mixed emotion at PGIMER. In this celebration of life, the true heroes were the aggrieved but brave-heart family of donor whose courageous decision to donate the kidneys and corneas of their dear Jasvir Kaur brought loads of happiness to four patients and their families. Chandigarh: BTech registration at PEC on.description: CHANDIGARH: Admission to Punjab Engineering College (deemed to be university) is now open and registration can be done till June 23. PEC is an institution of high repute and stands 73rd in the All India Ranking 2018 by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF). The institute, situated in Sector 12, Chandigarh, has also started PhD programmes in the disciplines of engineering, science, management, humanities and social sciences. Admission to its undergraduate and postgraduate programmes is done through national level examinations such as JEE (Main) and GATE. The 146-acre sprawling campus is divided into various functional zones like hostels, institute building, new academic block, administrative block, technology block, residential complex for faculty and staff and a mini market. In addition to lecture theatres, tutorial rooms, committee rooms, seminar rooms, board room, senate hall and drawing halls, the institute has an auditorium, open-air theatre, library and computer centre, reading rooms, workshops and well-equipped laboratories. The campus is under CCTV surveillance to ensure safety of students. Wi-Fi facility is provided only in the academic area. The college has a serene environment with varied foliage. It has palatial playgrounds, tennis courts, squash courts, swimming pool, gymnasium, student club and technical society area. The institute provides banking facilities to students through nationally connected ATMs and computerized post office. There are nine academic departments and two centres of excellence. The faculty of academic departments and centres is highly qualified. They make sure that the students are taught in a way that makes them have an edge over their peers. The college library covers an area of 27000 sq ft having two interlinked buildings — Old block and New block. It is fully air-conditioned, computerized with Libsys software and can accommodate around 382 students. The Wi-Fi enabled library is organized into various sections like circular section, periodical section, reference section, multimedia section, newspaper/ magazine section, technical section, book bank (general and book bank SC/ST), binding section, which are manned by professionally qualified staff. There is a special room on the ground floor for the library users who are physically challenged. The college library has a total number of 1,20,500 books, more than 3,000 e-journals, more than 3800 e-books and around 2500 e-resources in the form of CDs, DVDs, video cassettes. It also provides access to anti-plagiarism software. There is RFID system for efficient tracking of books. A self-services station has also been installed to facilitate users with self-issue/ return of documents. Theft detection pedestals have been installed at the entrance and exit gates of the library to check the movement of unissued books outside the library. Hostel accommodation is provided to the students as per the availability of rooms. The hostel can accommodate around 1,240 college inmates including boys and girls. Hostel rooms are spacious and fully furnished. Common rooms are fully air-conditioned for recreational facilities. There is provision of newspapers and magazines, common television set, equipment for indoor/outdoor games. Each hostel has a separate mess that provides nutritious vegetarian food. Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Hooda will leave Cong: BJP min.description: KAITHAL: Haryana minister of state for social justice and empowerment Krishan Kumar Bedi on Monday claimed that state politics would see a major twist in the next 10 days as former chief minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda would leave Congress and join another political party. Addressing mediapersons in Kaithal after a meeting with sanity workers, Bedi said Hooda had been feeling sidelined as Congress had ignored his demand of Ashok Tanwar’s removal from the post of party state president. “Hooda is a self-esteemed man and would not stay in the party if his demand is not met,” he claimed. Terming himself as fortune teller, he said that he had predicted split of Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) three-and-a-half years ago. Making another forecast, he said Digvijay Chautala also would leave his brother Dushyant Chautala after the assembly election. Bedi said the BJP government has provided jobs and put in place a fair and transparent system for the purpose. “We are not arrogant, but people support our policy for the state. We are sure public would vote us to power again on the basis of jobs, health, education, and development in the state,” he maintained. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MC keeps RWAs away from decision-making.description: CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh municipal corporation is spending lakhs of rupees in executing various works in the city, but these are of no use as the civic body has not considered recommendations of the resident welfare associations.Representatives of various RWAs are of a view that if the authorities concerned involve them before taking a final decision on installation of open gyms in parks, plantation of trees, installation of solar panels in houses and setting up of a carcass plant in Dadumajra, it will not only safe their money, but also fulfil the demands of the residents. Col Gursewak Singh, president of RWA-MHC, said Foswac had to work on three aspects with the authorities. There should be accountability of the officers for all the petty and main projects implemented in the city and before taking any decision, the area RWA should be consulted and suggestions should be taken on the same. The system of executing works should be streamlined. Referring to the issue which the RWA-MHC is facing, he said: “The MC officials should have set up the open air gym at the corner of the Shivalik park in Manimajra so that women feel comfortable. But the new gym has been set up in the middle of the park again.” He said the authorities were not taking note of the resident welfare associations, who are the voice of the public of the area. Lakhanpal, representative of the Sector 15 RWA, said the authorities concerned did not bother to involve the residents while widening the roads as greenery on the V6 roads has been completely vanished. Pardeep Chopra, representative of Foswac, said: “Without consulting residents, the authorities concerned issued directions that installation of the solar panel is mandatory. This is unfair as there are many residents who cannot afford the same.” K L Aggarwal, president, MSC duplex, Manimajra, said he had raised the issue of installing concrete benches on sand a number of times, but all in vain. Neither the officer nor the area councillor bothered to listen to the resident welfare association. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23.
